TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit GnuTarEntry extends System.Formats.Tar.PosixTarEntry
Public NotInheritable Class GnuTarEntry Inherits PosixTarEntry
public ref class GnuTarEntry sealed : System::Formats::Tar::PosixTarEntry

Docs.summary: Represents a tar entry from an archive of the GNU format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Even though the <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryFormat.Gnu> format is not POSIX compatible, it implements and supports the Unix-specific fields that were defined in the POSIX IEEE P1003.1 standard from 1988: `devmajor`, `devminor`, `gname`, and `uname`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Formats.Tar.TarEntry other) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance by converting the specified entry into the GNU format.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType entryType, string entryName) cil managed
Public Sub New (entryType As TarEntryType, entryName As String)

Docs.param: A string with the path and file name of this entry.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance with the specified entry type and entry name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
When creating an instance using the <xref:System.Formats.Tar.GnuTarEntry.%23ctor(System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType,System.String)> constructor, only the following entry types are supported:
- In all platforms: <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.Directory>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.HardLink>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.SymbolicLink>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.RegularFile>. - In Unix platforms only: <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.BlockDevice>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.CharacterDevice> and <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.Fifo>.

Docs.exception: The entry type is not supported for creating an entry.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.AccessTime : DateTimeOffset with get, set
public: property DateTimeOffset AccessTime { DateTimeOffset get(); void set(DateTimeOffset value); };

Docs.summary: A timestamp that represents the last time the file represented by this entry was accessed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
In Unix platforms, this timestamp is commonly known as `atime`.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ChangeTime : DateTimeOffset with get, set
public: property DateTimeOffset ChangeTime { DateTimeOffset get(); void set(DateTimeOffset value); };

Docs.summary: A timestamp that represents the last time the metadata of the file represented by this entry was changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
In Unix platforms, this timestamp is commonly known as `ctime`.
